alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 03 at 5:30AM CDT until April 03 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Monroe County in south central Alabama... East central Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... South central Wilcox County in south central Alabama... North central Conecuh County in south central Alabama... * Until 630 AM CDT. * At 530 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Whatley, or 11 miles east of Jackson, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Peterman, Whatley, Beatrice and Vredenburgh. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
